data.text: Let’s travel together, share with us the photos you took during your last trip flying with EthiopianAirlines . Tag us and use #EtMoments we will be happy to share them on our profile and stories. https://t.co/JZ6qBpwq4N

“We have the most extensive cargo network, the largest fleet, the largest cargo terminal, the most interconnections. I am optimistic that we will definitely return to normal. Our long-term strategy remains unchanged.”
Mr. Tewolde Gebremariam, Group CEO of #Ethiopian. https://t.co/OjO1RmaUNo
The opening of Ethiopian’s second trans-Africa route in 1984 linking Addis Ababa with Niamey, Bamako and Dakar. https://t.co/7Qs2eC8I4D

data.text:
#Ethiopia is looking to its national carrier to help it navigate economic shocks from the corona virus pandemic at a time when airlines across the world are approaching governments for bailouts.
#Bloomberg
https://t.co/qP5TNeJNAc https://t.co/ItXzIAm4LM

RT @fitsumaregaa: Thank you all for the PPE & Medical Equipment donations to #Ethiopia. 
Your support saves lives! 

We appreciate PPE & me…

@Nohelema Dear @Nohelema, We are very pleased to hear about your experience. Kindly Inbox (DM) us your ticket details along with your shebamiles number and email address so that we can assist you. Regards

We will reunite with our loved ones and keep exploring the world. Let’s stay strong and united in the fight against the pandemic.
Stay safe!
#Ethiopian https://t.co/xdDgmFpdN3

“No one thought that an airline from a developing African country would come to serve South American countries such as Brazil and Argentina. But this is what happened.”
Group CEO Mr. Tewolde Gebremariam
#Ethiopian, navigating through a perfect storm!
https://t.co/r5cb2HaW6X https://t.co/SrMS7n3XtW

@jaykwashie Dear WeShallOvercomeC-19,Thank you for contacting us. We apologize for the inconvenience you had earlier kindly DM us your ticket number along with your reservation code and email so that we may help you accordingly.

data.text:
While commemorating the founding of the Organization of African Unity (now the African Union), which was established on 25 May 1963 in Addis Ababa, we are committed to contain the spread of COVID-19 through our unity of purpose. 
  Happy Africa Day! https://t.co/zvzmen3Fu7
Ethiopian Airlines wishes a happy holiday to all Muslims. Eid Mubarak! https://t.co/jJy49LOs8E

Ethiopian MRO has extensive capabilities to provide maintenance services to its own fleet and third-party customers. The maintenance unit is playing a critical role in supporting the airline as it faces challenges posed by COVID-19. #EthiopianMRO
https://t.co/1KmbeyQqsL

data.text:
While COVID keeps us apart, distant and lonely, we are bringing people together to their beloved ones in our repatriation flights. We are always alert to your request and serve you with our commended service. 
#flyethiopian https://t.co/3DdxLAAZ8R

We have successfully delivered the much needed medical supplies to African countries. #EthiopianCargo #Cargowithcare
Watch video: https://t.co/9ssqkfQD0R
